scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. You explained that it was a one-time thing to make sure the team didn't struggle. [Monica] frowns slightly while [Bob] crosses his arms. You acknowledged the need to set clearer boundaries.
scenes.description: [Bob] finally speaks up, 'But [Alex], isn't it your responsibility to ensure the project runs smoothly, even if you're on leave?'

options.text: I see where you're coming from, Bob. I'll definitely consider how to manage this better in the future.
options.analysis: You acknowledge the concern, showing good emotional regulation and perception while indicating a need for clearer boundaries.

options.text: Maybe, but it's also important for me to have uninterrupted time off to recharge.
options.analysis: You firmly assert the importance of your time off, showing strong self-regulation but lower empathy and motivation.

options.text: Let's focus on finishing the current task well. We can discuss how to handle such situations more effectively later.
options.analysis: You keep the conversation focused on the present task while acknowledging the need for future improvements, showing good emotional perception and empathy.
